metadata: (info { (description "Settilth is a race game played by the Najavo of New Mexico. ") (rules "Forty stones placed in a circle, with a larger gap after every tenth stone. The gaps are the playing spaces. One stick per player, all of which begin in one of the larger gaps. Three sticks, one side round and the other flat, used as dice. Throws are as follows: three round sides up = 10; three flat sides up = 5; all others = 0.") (source "DLP evidence.") (id "844") (version "1.3.14") (classification "board/race/reconstruction/pending") (credit "Eric Piette") (origin "This game was played in New Mexico, around 1893.") } ) (graphics { (show Edges (colour Hidden)) (show Symbol "disc" Vertex (sites Board Vertex) fillColour:(colour Grey) edgeColour:(colour Black) scale:0.5) (board Background image:"disc" edgeColour:(colour Black) scale:0.1) })
